website_summaries.verdict: A good model airplane kit for kids and adults learning to assemble basic balsa wood models.
pros: Pieces are precut for easy assembly and gluing
Model is actually flyable with the included rubber motor
The model is light for extended flying times
cons: Fragile balsa wood and plastic require care when handling and assembling the model

customer_reviews.title: You're Never too Old for Model Airplanes
customer_reviews.text: I put a ton of these together in my early teens and just bought one to put together again for old times sake. It's awesome! Just as fun as I remember it. You can't go wrong with this classic. All the instructions are nicely labeled as well as the balsa wood parts. Several of my friends were helping me and now they are buying some as well. You're never too old for model airplanes. :) I don't think the packaging has changed since I was a kid (except for a web address and a few tweaks). Awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Snader

customer_reviews.title: Hubby Loved It
customer_reviews.text: Since my husband retired, he's been going on and on about making these wooden model airplanes. Got him this for Father's Day and he's like a kid in a candy store. It's exactly what he wanted and went together easily.
customer_reviews.author: Becky Muth

customer_reviews.title: Easy to build
customer_reviews.text: Typical Guillows laser cut balsa kit. Easy to build. The covering paper supplied is a type of light weight Polykote tissue easy and forgiving to use. Plans and direction is pretty basic but easy to follow. I would recommend this kit.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Hillbun

customer_reviews.title: This is better for a young teenager
customer_reviews.text: This isn't appropriate for ages 6 and up as advertised. This is better for a young teenager. It requires patience and time. The balsa wood is very fragile, so it requires care in handling and assembly. I wanted a project to do with my almost five year old - he's very interested and can help, but patience and care in handling has turned this into mommy's project instead.
customer_reviews.author: asef

customer_reviews.title: Fun to build
customer_reviews.text: Fun to build, so far. I have the wings, rubber, and elevator done, and I am now working on the fuselage. Lots of fun and satisfaction to build. It's my first kit build and Im lovin it. I just work on it for 20 minutes or an hour or so here and there.
customer_reviews.author: graphingofphotons

customer_reviews.title: Poor instructions; bad product description
customer_reviews.text: Instructions were not at all printed clearly or easy to follow. Pictures in instructions were very poor quality. And it would be nice if they would mention in the product description that you need to buy wood cement on your own (not included).
customer_reviews.author: aserm

customer_reviews.title: Great build
customer_reviews.text: Overall great model kit. As long as you have foam board, pins, quick dry cement, fine sandpaper and some patience it is a very enjoyable build, with better instructions than I was expecting. Took me about 15 hours. I added a set of E-flight bush wheels and a belly pod for a more rugged look but it’s great either way. The only thing I would change is buying different tissue, but that’s no big deal. Final note, it probably flies great with some micro tuning but it could definitely use some more structural components around the wings so be weary.
customer_reviews.author: Calvin S.

customer_reviews.title: Requires advanced modeling skills if built as a flyer.
customer_reviews.text: The support structures for the wings require modification/strengthening if it is to be flown. This requires more advanced skills, tools and some materials. It's also quite large. As a display model it could be a beginner project. Laser cut parts are great.
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: Brought back memories. Used to buy for a dollar ...
customer_reviews.text: Brought back memories. Used to buy for a dollar. There is a you tube video about building this kit which I reccomend
customer_reviews.author: J. T. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Very nice kit
customer_reviews.text: The laser cut parts make a world of difference vs. other Guillow's kits.
customer_reviews.author: Robert R

customer_reviews.title: Nice kit
customer_reviews.text: Good laser cut..But some balsa is a little soft. Fun kit to build.
customer_reviews.author: thomas elliott

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The best thing to do in the winter with 3 1/2 foot of snow and -31 degrees.
customer_reviews.author: Sue P.

customer_reviews.title: I loved these airplanes years ago and they haven't changed
customer_reviews.text: I loved these airplanes years ago and they haven't changed, other than using laser cut parts. WONDERFUL little balsa kits !!
customer_reviews.author: Billy J.

customer_reviews.title: A great way to pass the time
customer_reviews.text: My son and I enjoyed building the model and it was a great way to spend time togther will sitting at home!
customer_reviews.author: Jim Stafford

customer_reviews.title: Product not as shown. Make sure you read the description.
customer_reviews.text: Product was not as shown or described. I am very unsatisfied with the product I received. This package and features shows a 24” wing and the box I received shows 20”.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is the glue needed for the model airplane kit. Thank you Amazon for providing it.
customer_reviews.author: Bernardette

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to assemble if inexperienced.
customer_reviews.text: Craftsmanship is poor. Instructions are very unclear. Still fun to build nonetheless.
customer_reviews.author: ME

customer_reviews.title: Since Guillows started producing these kits in laser cut form ...
customer_reviews.text: Since Guillows started producing these kits in laser cut form this hobby has become so much more enjoyable. This is the first such model Ive complete that didn't end up crumpled into a ball of frustration.
customer_reviews.author: Firstscout

customer_reviews.title: Nice Model
customer_reviews.text: I've been away from the hobby for fifty years but the state of the flying model art has changed. This kit is simple to assemble (providing you have the tools to assemble it). the wood quality is excellent, the parts are laser cut and you can modify it to accept electrical power and RC guidance! Nice kit!
customer_reviews.author: W. Derr

customer_reviews.title: Laser. cut balsa easy removed
customer_reviews.text: Laser cut balsa is the greatest. I had problems before breaking the Parts while pressing them out of the balsa strip.
customer_reviews.author: David A. Finkas

customer_reviews.title: Pretty difficult to make actually
customer_reviews.text: Pretty difficult to make actually, be careful to not break the wood! but having a lot of fun making it with my dad!
customer_reviews.author: Milan

customer_reviews.title: There was nothing I did not like with this kit
customer_reviews.text: There was nothing I did not like with this kit. I had a great time putting it together and everything I needed was in the kit except for the dope.
customer_reviews.author: dennis moore

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble and all the parts actually came out ...
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and all the parts actually came out of the sheet like they were supposed too bought big rubber bush wheels for mine
customer_reviews.author: colton

customer_reviews.title: My first build with laser-cut balsa parts. What a ...
customer_reviews.text: My first build with laser-cut balsa parts. What a pleasure to build! Wish they had that when we were building as kids.
customer_reviews.author: Ray kaluga

customer_reviews.title: Super fun to build
customer_reviews.text: Super fun to build. I had one when I was a young boy and never got to finish it. My boys enjoyed watching it come together too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: a very nice kit - I would recommend for beginners
customer_reviews.author: W. Keith Douglass

customer_reviews.title: Bucket of fun with a little frustration.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to build with my stepson. It is a pretty good model, but the "laser cut" balsa is not cut through. some basic cutting skills will be helpful.(sharp x-actos) The instructins are clear if you have some model building experience. It was a good intro for my son to see how to build a rubber powered model.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher M. de los Santos

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My husband like the kit. It brought back early boy hood memories.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Picture is wrong. You will get a different model
customer_reviews.text: The picture in this item is wrong. You will not get the 24" wingspan version pictured, but instead the you will get the cheaper, die-cut 20" version. Very deceiving.
customer_reviews.author: jjmelo

customer_reviews.title: Excellent products​, i have built these models since i ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent products​, i have built these models since i was a young child and still just as fun as an adult. Highly recommended to anyone looking for a fun time consuming hobby.
customer_reviews.author: Max R.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good quality material and sufficient instructions . Much improved over previous version of these kits a fe years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Maxwell Crumley

customer_reviews.title: Nice kit, good die cut parts
customer_reviews.text: Nice kit, good die cut parts. The tissue supplied is way to thin. Hard to work with and punctures easily once applied.
customer_reviews.author: D. Owen

customer_reviews.title: read the fine print
customer_reviews.text: I didn't realize it is BLUE! And it is balsa wood, not plastic like I had hoped.
customer_reviews.author: dojo

customer_reviews.title: if your planning on using the decals they are of the poorest quality I have ever seen so it is best to forget them
customer_reviews.text: I have built many of these models, this is fair quality, if your planning on using the decals they are of the poorest quality I have ever seen so it is best to forget them, laser cut pieces are of better quality than there more expensive models, not a bad model for the price,,but not a good one either.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S.

customer_reviews.title: THE PRICE WAS GREAT TO. I DON'T KNOW HOW YOU DO IT ...
customer_reviews.text: I CANN'T WAIT TO GET STARTED ON IT .THE PRICE WAS GREAT TO . I DON'T KNOW HOW YOU DO IT BUT KEEP UP THE WORK AND YOU HAVE SOME HAPPY HOLIDAYS YOUR WAY
customer_reviews.author: LEE POUNDS

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Have builted 65 of Guilliow's models and I love them.
customer_reviews.author: Robert L. Willcox

customer_reviews.title: Piper Cub
customer_reviews.text: I had a difficult time to find a bulsa plane my grandson and I could build. Most were RTF. We now have a project that he and I will have years to remember long after the project has been completed.
customer_reviews.author: george g.

product_meta.title: Guillow's Piper Super Cub 95 Laser Cut Model Kit
product_meta.description:
FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Guillow's is the recognized leader in quality scale balsa model airplane kits. Our model construction kits are the last word in scale realism for the super detail fan and light weight for those who build and fly. Each model is a small but faithful replica of an airplane widely known for deeds in wartime or present day popularity. Series 300 features popular private planes still in use today by many private pilots, with precision laser-cut parts for easier assembly.
feature_bullets: Piper Super Cub has a 24" wingspan
Precision laser cut balsa parts, scale WWI plastic wheels, full set of decals, vacuum formed plastic parts and all accessories needed
Fly with included rubber power motor or convert to electric or gas engine
Complete instructions for building either to fly or for static display

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
